intro: Diacalpe medogensis, commonly known as the Yunnan diacalpe, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Yunnan Province in China. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments at elevations above 1,500 meters. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in botanical gardens. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
